I became aware of this movement of the sun within the Pantheon before I discovered Sperling 1999, who elaborates on the idea in much greater detail

While Grainger 1933 was sympathetic to the idea of the Pantheon as a sundial, he dismissed it as useless in Rome, and instead calculated it as relevant for Syracuse and Rhodes, seemingly unaware of the better parallelism between the building and the roofed spherical sundial, which would tie the building directly to the latitude of Rome
